answers.answer: Oooh, bizarre!!!!The only "warm" sensations I ever have are more along the lines of "burning" and only come during *that time of the month*.... According to my OB, it's radiating nerve pain because my right ovary swells up and presses against a nerve.This sounds NOTHING like that though.... Does it actually fell wet?This post seems to touch on similar symptoms:http://www.medhelp.org/posts/Neurology/Cold-Wet-Feeling-on-an-area-on-my-leg/show/509541It sounds like ti's something you should bring up with your physician. Have you had any recent illnesses?

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!A heat sensation or sudden feeling of warmth can be a sign of blood clot or deep vein thrombosis. It can also be due to pinched nerve or due to diabetic neuropathy. If you are on birth control pills, then this could be due to the side effect of pills as they can also cause deep vein thrombosis. For diagnosis first a duplex ultrasound or color dopplar would need to be done. If this is negative then a nerve conduction study and test for diabetes. If there is a chance then if everything else is negative, then lupus may need to be tested for.Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!
Come to think of it the sensation was around time of the month... hmmm...  Its not actually wet to the touch... just feels like something spilled there, but is dry.  No recent illnesses.
Thank you for the information.  I will get checked asap!

I had the same sensation last month on both inner thighs around the pelvic area as though I spilled warm water or pee'd in my pants (just around that area), but neither occurred. It is the most odd feeling and I don't know how to explain. I am 22yr male.

question: I am a 29 year old female.  I have recently (about a week and a half now) been having an occasional warm sensation in my right lower inner thigh.  It feels like I spilled something warm on my leg, but that is never the case.  No other symptoms.  No pain, no numbness... What could it be?
title: Occasional warm sensation in lower inner thigh
